metadata.title: CVE-2022-0137 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap buffer overflow in image_set_mask function of HTMLDOC before 1.9.15allows an attacker to write outside the buffer boundaries.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0137` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

htmldoc - 1.9.15-1
htmldoc-common - 1.9.15-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: htmldoc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.15-1').
